snippet: The defeat of Islamic State forces at the Baiji refinery is one of the first significant indications of progress against the extremist group in months.
abstract: Iraqi counterterrorism forces and their allied Shiite militias announce they have retaken oil refinery in Baiji, which was held by Islamic State forces; recapture of refinery is hailed as important strategic step, and boon to morale, as it is first significant progress against group in months.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Ahmed Salah contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The defeat of Islamic State forces at the Baiji refinery is one of the first significant indications of progress against the extremist group in months.

headline.main: Iraqi Forces and Shiite Militias Retake Oil Refinery From ISIS
headline.print_headline: Iraq Retakes Key Refinery in Rare Sign of Progress

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
